title: Drawing, "Design for a Pitcher", 1520–50
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Shown in profile. The handle, which stands with a claw upon the shoulder, is at right. The bottom part of the body and the shoulder is fluted. Between is a frieze with bead festoons supported by cherubim. A mask is under the handle.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Pitcher", 1520–50.
1520–50. Pen and ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-967.
